Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘BK-Mini’ offers a profound, rich umami flavor with earthy, almost wine-like notes and a hint of black truffle. The caps are small, 3-5 cm in diameter, and range from dark gray to nearly black, while the stems are thick, dense, and pure white inside, growing 5-8 cm tall. The entire fruiting body has an exceptionally firm, low-moisture texture from cap to stem base.

2. The Meaty Texture Specialist This mushroom’s extraordinary density and rich flavor make it ideal for applications where it can mimic or replace meat.

  • Scallop and Steak Substitute: Sliced thickly across the stem to create medallions that sear beautifully, developing a crust while maintaining a tender, juicy interior similar to scallops or beef.
  • Grilled and Barbecued: Holds its shape perfectly on the grill, developing a smoky char without becoming tough or rubbery.
  • Slow-Cooked and Braised: Its dense structure allows it to be braised for long periods, absorbing flavors while retaining a satisfying, meaty bite.
  • Shaved Raw: The stems can be shaved paper-thin on a mandoline for a dramatic, flavorful addition to salads and crudi.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘BK-Mini’ is a reliable, moderate-speed fruiter that produces dense, heavy clusters. Harvest when the caps are still slightly incurred but the stems have thickened substantially. Supplied as a pre-colonized MycoBlock™, it provides a substantial yield by weight of 400–600g of incredibly dense mushrooms over 2 flushes, with the first harvest ready 12-16 days after initiating fruiting conditions.
